text: Alma Gluck (May 11, 1884October 27, 1938) was a Romanian-American soprano. She was one of the world's most famous female singers at the peak of her career, around 1910. She was married to violinist Efrem Zimbalist, Sr.. She was the mother of actor Efrem Zimbalist, Jr.. Gluck was born in Ia»ôi, Romania. Gluck died in New York City from liver failure, aged 54. ==References== Category:1884 births Category:1938 deaths Category:Singers from New York City Category:Deaths from liver failure Category:Disease-related deaths in New York City Category:Jewish American musicians Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Romanian Jews Category:Sopranos
title: Alma Gluck
